item.description:
Difficulty: Easy (est. 100 ft of elevation change)
Distance: Est. 5 miles round-trip
Duration: Est. 2 hours + lunch at a group pace.

Photo: Prescott Penninsula from the Beach at Hank's Meadow

HIKE DESCRIPTION

This is a very easy hike. We'll be in the woods except when we reach Hank's Meadow, which has a lovely beach. It can be a good place to enjoy a breeze (if there is one), as well as a lovely picnic spot.

There are outhouses both at the start and destination, stocked with TP and sanitizer. All you need is sunscreen, bug spray, a snack -- and OF COURSE -- WATER.

 

IMPORTANT INFORMATION

Quabbin Regulations

  • No swimming or wading (public water supply).
  • No pets (same reason).
  • "Carry in, carry out"...take your trash with you.
  • Do not remove things from the reservations

Tick Precautions

Deer ticks are in full force this year, and they flourish at Quabbin. Please bring repellant with DEET or Pemethyrin. Check yourself for ticks after traversing any brush, and check yourself when you get home.

It takes 3-4 days for a tick (*IF* it has the bacteria) to transmit Lyme disease. If you remove the tick promptly, you cannot get Lyme disease. If you don't get the head, you cannot get Lyme disease (contrary to popular myth).

I have hiked at Quabbin dozens of times in the last year and got bit by a tick only once...as the Boy Scouts say, "Be prepared!" (And you don't have to worry.)

 

DIRECTIONS

I'm in a rush to leave the house, but I wanted to post this since Bob and I planned last-minute. Will post directions tomorrow (Monday)!

From Worcester and points East:

Take Route 9 west. Pass through Leicester, Spencer, the Brookfields, and Ware. After downtown Ware there are two long, steep hills with passing lanes. Look for a dirt pull-off with a barrier after the second hill. Go past that, and you'll see the East Entrance on the right after a couple of curves. (If you pass a marsh on both sides of Route 9, you've gone too far.)

Using the East Entrance, continue straight almost a mile. On the right is a small white "Goodnough Dike" sign. The dirt parking lot is immediately before this, on the right.

FYI, if you missed the East Entrance just use the middle one. Eventually, you'll come to a rotary; go straight, not uphill to the right. Goodnough Dike will be on the left, more than a mile after the rotary, maybe closer to two.

From North-Central Massachusetts:

Take Route 31 or I-290 south to Route 9, then follow directions "from Worcester" as above. Or, if it's closer, take 122 north (it goes diagonally west), then Route 37A south to Route 9. See the directions from Worcester...pick it up from downtown Ware.

Or if Route 2 is convenient:

Take Route 2 to exit 19, onto Route 202 South. After 20 minutes on 202, turn left to go east on Route 9. The East Entrance is the 3rd entrance on your left; it takes 5 minutes to pass all 3 entrances. Before you see the East Entrance, you will pass a marsh on both sides of the road.

 

The best way to ask questions is to post as comments. Not only does it save another person having to ask the same thing...I OFTEN GET VERY BEHIND ON MY EMAIL. I may not see the questions in a timely manner, and I don't want anyone to feel ignored.
item.how_to_find_us: I drive a small, white Dodge Stratus. There is a dirt lot immediately before the intersection with the loop road (has sign "Goodnough Dike"). I will either park there or in the intersection itself depending on sun. Just look for me near the outhouse!
